definition: to wash/to squander/to sweep away/to move/to shake/dissolute/pond
grass radical 草字頭兒|草字头儿[cao3 zi4 tou2 r5]
soup/hot or boiling water/decoction of medicinal herbs/water in which sth has been boiled
to leave home to make one's way in the world/to leave the life one knows to seek success
to wander/to roam about/to loaf about/to be idle
to rage/to dash/to surge/also written 激盪|激荡
to obliterate completely/to vanish from the face of the earth

sentences.english: Joyful songs are still around our ears, cheerful drums are still in our hearts.
sentences.chinese: 愉悅的歌聲還回蕩在耳畔，快樂的鼓點還奏響在心中。

sentences.english: The survivors wandered about the jungle for days before being picked up by a search party.
sentences.chinese: 倖存者在叢林中游蕩了好幾天，才被搜索隊救出來。

sentences.english: They wandered the world and found half- made human beings.
sentences.chinese: 他們在世界上游蕩並創造出人類的半成品。

sentences.english: March Spring is warm, water chestnut green Mai Dang heart.
sentences.chinese: 又是三月春風暖，薺麥青青蕩心扉。

sentences.english: Realise this deeply, carry it in your heart when you walk the world.
sentences.chinese: 要透徹地領悟到這一點，在你窗蕩世界時銘記於心。

sentences.english: The rope dangled in the breeze.
College life may never be this tumultuous, but then again, this is TV.
sentences.chinese: 大學生活本不應該動動盪蕩，僅僅體現在熒屏上。

sentences.english: Laughter also reverberating in the ear, sigher engraved in the hearts.
sentences.chinese: 笑聲還回蕩在耳旁，情分依然刻在心上。

sentences.english: When it was time for his appointment he drifted uptown to the club entrance.
sentences.chinese: 快到約會的時間，他遊遊蕩蕩地向夜總會的大門走去。

sentences.english: The power of your ear-splitting war cry echoes across the battlefield.
sentences.chinese: 你震耳欲聾的戰爭吶喊在戰場上回蕩。

sentences.english: And all that handle the oar, the mariners, and all the pilots of the sea, shall come down from their ships, they shall stand upon the land;
sentences.chinese: 凡蕩槳的和水手，並一切泛海掌舵的，都必下船登岸。

sentences.english: Thin, hungry dogs roamed the streets.
sentences.chinese: 又瘦又餓的狗在街上游蕩。

sentences.english: He stopped hanging around and did something useful.
sentences.chinese: 他不再東蕩西逛，而是做了些有益的工作。

sentences.english: And so I dream of going back to be.
sentences.chinese: 現在還夢想着再去蕩一回樺樹。

sentences.english: The Cavity ringdown spectroscopy is a new spectroscopic technique.
sentences.chinese: 光腔衰蕩是新的光譜技術。

definition: to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm
to go and return/to return/to resume/to return to a normal or original state/to repeat/again/to recover/to restore/to turn over/to reply/to answer/to reply to a letter/to retaliate/to carry out
warp (the vertical threads in weaving)/vertical/longitudinal/north-south (lines of longitude)/lengthwise/to release/to indulge/even if
billows/great waves (fig. of a story with great momentum)
wind and rain/the elements/trials and hardships
bosom/heart/mind/to think of/to harbor in one's mind/to conceive (a child)
